data.title: Zombie Movie List
data.text:
This is a continually developing list of zombie films; that is, films and telemovies (and at times episodes of TV shows) that feature walking (and sometimes running) corpses, whether in the post-Romero mode, in the earlier voodoo-style tradition, or simply in respect to a very physical (and usually decayed) return from death. For assorted caveats, see the end of this page.

QUICK LINKS:

Comment on the film entries:

Some entries are not strictly speaking zombie films at all as, for example, the “zombies” in them may not be dead but simply will-less, controlled by an evil (or alien) master or virally mad (e.g. 28 Days Later...). In these “nearly dead” cases I have included the film for its thematic or tropic connection to the sub-genre. But I have generally excluded the classic “Mummy” movies — these will be the subject of another list, though (as with ghosts) there are inevitable crossovers (some ghosts are extremely visceral). You won’t find vampire movies here either, unless they include the more classically corpse-like undead as well as the literate, bloodsucking kind (and there are always the “hopping vampires” of Asian films). Finally, the other “back-from-the-dead” films I haven’t included are films based on Mary Shelley’s novel Frankenstein — again, with exceptions.

Titles, alternative titles, directors and dates are as accurate and complete as I can logistically manage, but different sources often vary in detail. Where there is disagreement, and the film was unavailable for viewing, I have generally followed Phil Hardy from his Aurum Film Encyclopedia of Horror or, failing that, information on the Internet Movie Database. Generally the date given is the date of first release rather than initial production, though I sometimes go by copyright, which, more often than not, is the production date. Often I haven’t included all title variants; in some instances there are just too many, so I have stuck to the most common. Also I have only included short zombie films that have signifacnt profile or which I have been able to view. Fortunately, many of these are appearing online these days. Some films with “zombie” in the title turn out not to be zombie films at all. I may have inadvertently included some of these, and hopefully over time they will be weeded out as I can view them. By the same token if your favourite obscure zombie flick isn’t here, let me know and I’ll put it in.
